48.a: He declared things from long ago and made them known, he suddenly did them and they came to pass.
48.q: What did Yahweh do, knowing that Israel was obsinate?

48.a: Yahweh wanted prevent Israel from saying, "My idol has done them," or "my carved figure, or my cast metal figure has ordained these things."
48.q: By declaring these things to Israel before hand what did Yahweh hope to prevent?

48.a: He will do this for the sake of his own name.
48.q: Why will Yahweh defer his anger and hold back from destroying Israel?

48.a: He purified them in the furnace of affliction.
Yahweh summoned his ally to accomplish his purpose against Babylon.
48.q: Who did Yahweh summon and for what purpose?

48.a: If they had obeyed their peace and prosperity would have flowed like a river and their deliverance like the waves of the sea. Their descendants would have been as numerous as the sand and the children from the womb like its grains. Their name would not have been cut off nor blotted out from before him.
48.q: What would have happened if Israel had obeyed Yahweh's commandments?

48.a: The announcement is, "Yahweh has redeemed his servant Jacob".
48.q: What announcement is to be made to go to the ends of the earth?

48.a: Yahweh said there was no peace for the wicked.
48.q: Who did Yahweh say would receive no peace?

49.a: Yahweh called him by name from birth. He made Israel's mouth like a sharp sword and hid Israel in the shadow of his hand; he made Israel into a polished arrow; in his quiver Yahweh hid him.
49.q: What did Yahweh do for his servant Israel?

49.a: Yahweh is going to show his glory through Israel.
49.q: What is Yahweh going to do through Israel?

49.a: Israel says his justice is with Yahweh and his reward is with his God.
49.q: What is Israel trusting Yahweh for?

49.a: His job is to resore Jacob again to Yahweh and to gather Israel to him.
49.q: What is Israel's job as Yahweh's servant?

49.a: It is too small a thing to be Yahweh's servant to reestablish the tribes of Jacob, and to restore the survivors of Israel.
49.q: What is too small a thing for Yahweh's servant?

49.a: He will make his servant a light to the gentiles that his servant may be Yahweh's salvation to the ends of the earth.
49.q: What further will Yahweh do for his servant?

49.a: Kings will see him and arise, and princes will see him and bow down.
49.q: What will happen to the one who is despised, abhored by the nations, a slave of rulers?

49.a: At a time Yahweh decides to show his favor he will answer his servant, and in a day of salvation Yahweh will protect his servant.
49.q: When will Yahweh help and answer his servant?

49.a: He is given as a covenant for the people to rebuild the land, to reassign the desolate inheritance.
49.q: For what purpose is Yahweh's servant given as a covenant for the people?

49.a: He who has mercy on the prisoners will lead them.
They are to sing and be joyful because Yahweh comforts his people, and will have compassion on his afflicted.
49.q: Why are the heavens, earth and mountains supposed to sing and be joyful?

49.a: Yahweh's answer to Zion was, "Can a woman forget her baby, nursing at her breast, so she does not have compassion on the son she has borne? Yes, they may forget, but I will not forget you.
49.q: What was Yahweh's answer to Zion when they complained; "Yahweh has forsaken me, and the Lord has forgotten me."?

49.a: Yahweh states his proof as follows: "Look , I have inscribed your name on my palms; your walls are continually before me. Your children are hurrying back, while those who destroyed you are departing. Look around and see, they are all gathering and coming to you.
49.q: What does Yahweh offer as proof of his concern for Zion?

49.a: The will say, "The place is too cramped for us, make room for us, so we may live here.
49.q: What will the children born during the time of Zion's bereavement say?

49.a: She will ask, "Who has borne these children for me?" and "Who has raised these children?" and finally, "...where did these come from?"
The peoples of the nations will bring them back.
49.q: Who will bring Zion's sons and daughters back?

49.a: Yes, the captives will be taken away from the warrior and spoils will be rescued; for Yahweh will oppose Zion's adversary and save her children.
49.q: Can the spoils be taken from the warrior or captives be rescued from a tyrant?

49.a: He will feed their oppressors with their own flesh.
49.q: What will Yahweh do to Zion's oppressors?

49.a: They will know that Yahweh is Zion's savior and redeemer, the mighty one of Jacob.

50.a: Zion was sold because of her sins, and because of her rebellion, her mother was sent away.
50.q: Why was Zion sold and her mother sent away?

50.a: At Yahweh's rebuke the sea dries up and he makes the rivers a desert. Yahweh clothes the sky with darkness and cover it with sackcloth.
He has given his servant a tongue as one of those who is taught.
50.q: What has Yahweh given to his servant?

50.a: Yahweh's servant spoke a sustaining word to the weary one.
50.q: What did Yahweh's servant do with the tongue Yahweh gave him?

50.a: Yahweh's servant gave his back to those who beat him and his cheeks to those who plucked out his beard; He did not hide his face from acts of shame and spitting.
50.q: Because he was not rebellious and did not turn away backward, what did Yahweh's servant do?

50.a: The servant says he is not disgraced because the Lord Yahweh will help him.
50.q: Why does Yahweh's servant say he is not disgraced?

50.a: His accusers will all wear out like a garment; the moth will eat them up.
50.q: What will happen to those who accuse Yahweh's servant and declare him guilty?

50.a: He should trust in the name of Yahweh and lean on his God.
50.q: What should the one who fears Yahweh, who obeys the voice of his servant and the one who walks in deep darkness without light, do?

50.a: Yahweh's servant will cause them to lie down in a place of pain.
50.q: What will Yahweh's servant do to all who kindle a fire, who gird on flames?

51.a: Yahweh said to look at the rock from which you were chiseled and to the quarry from which you were cut.
51.q: What did Yahweh say those who pursue righteousness should look to?

51.a: Yahweh called him, blessed him and made him many.
51.q: What did Yahweh do to Abraham?

51.a: The heavens will vanish away like smoke, the earth will wear out like a garment; and its inhabitants will die like flies.
51.q: What will happen to the heavens, the earth and its inhabitants?

51.a: Yahweh's righteousness will continue forever and his righteousness will never stop working.
51.q: What will continue forever and never stop working?

51.a: That statement is directed to those who know what is right and the people who have Yahweh's law in their heart.
51.q: To whom is this statement directed to: "Do not fear the insult of men, nor be disheartened by their abuse..."?

51.a: The arm of Yahweh did these things.
51.q: Who crushed the sea monster, dried up the sea and made the depths of the sea into a way for the redeemed to pass through?

51.a: Joy will overtake them and sorrow and mourning will flee away.
51.q: What will overtake and what will flee away from the ransomed of Yahweh when they return and come to Zion?

51.a: Yahweh will hurry to release him.
51.q: What will Yahweh do for the one who is bent down?

51.a: They drank the cup of Yahweh's anger; they drank the bowl, the cup of staggering.
51.q: What did Jerusalem drink from the hand of Yahweh?

51.a: There is no one among all the sons she has born to guide her.
51.q: Who among all the son's of Jerusalem has been born to guide her?

51.a: He will put it into the hand of Jerusalem's tormentors.
51.q: After Yahweh takes away the cup of staggering from Jerusalem who will he give it to?

52.a: Never again will the uncircumcised or the unclean enter Jerusalem.
52.q: What will never again happen to Jerusalem?

52.a: They will know Yahweh's name because his name is slandered continually all the day.
52.q: In that day why will Yahweh's people know Yahweh's name?

52.a: Every eye of Zion's watchmen will see Yahweh's return to Zion.
52.q: Who will see Yahweh's return to Zion?

52.a: They should do this because Yahweh has comforted his people; he has redeemed Jerusalem. Yahweh has bared his holy arm in the sight of all the nations.
52.q: Why should the ruins of Jerusalem break forth into joyful singing together?

52.a: They are to leave, touch nothing unclean and purify themselves.
52.q: What are those who carry the vessels of Yahweh to do?

52.a: They don't need to be in a rush or panic because Yahweh will go before them and the God of Israel will be their rearguard.
52.q: Why do Yahweh's people not need to be in a rush or panic when they leave?

52.a: He will deal wisely and be successful; he will be exalted and lifted high, and will be very exalted.
His appearance was disfigured from human appearance.
52.q: What happened to the appearance of Yahweh's servant?

52.a: Kings will close their mouths because of him.
52.q: What will kings do because of Yahweh's servant?

53.a: He grew up before Yahweh like a sapling, and like a sprout out of parched earth.
53.q: How did Yahweh's servant grow up?

53.a: He had no remarkable appearance or splendor; when we saw him, there was no beauty to attract us to him.
53.q: What did Yahweh's servant look like?

53.a: He was despised and rejected by people and considered insignificant.
53.q: How was Yahweh's servant received by people?

53.a: He bore our sicknesses and carried our sorrows.
53.q: What did Yahweh's servant do for us?

53.a: He was pierced for our rebellious deeds and crushed because of our sins.
53.q: Why was Yahweh's servant pierced and crushed?

53.a: His punishment brought us peace and his wounds healed us.
53.q: What did the servant's punishment and wounds do for us?

53.a: We are like sheep because we have all gone astray; we have each turned to his own way.
Coercion and judgment were the methods used to condemn him.
53.q: What methods were used to condemn Yahweh's servant?

53.a: He was cut off because of the offense of his people.
53.q: Why was Yahweh's servant cut off from the land of the living?

53.a: No. He had done no violence nor had there been any deceit in his mouth.
53.q: Had Yahweh's servant done anything wrong?

53.a: It was Yahweh's will so that Yahweh's purpose might be accomplished through him.
53.q: Why was it Yahweh's will to crush his servant?

53.a: Yahweh will give his servant his portion because he poured out his soul to death and was numbered with the transgressors. He bore the sins of many and made intercession for the transgressions.
53.q: Why will Yahweh give his servant his portion among the multitudes?

54.a: He says she should sing, for the children of the desolate one are more than the children of the married woman.
54.q: Why does Yahweh say the barren woman should sing?

54.a: They will conquer nations and resettle desolate cities.
54.q: What will the descendants of Zion do?

54.a: Yahweh of Hosts, Zion's maker, is their husband.
He abandoned her for a short time.
54.q: What did Yahweh do to Israel?

54.a: With great compassion Yahweh will gather them.
54.q: What will Yahweh do for Israel?

54.a: He swore he would no longer be angry with them or rebuke them.
54.q: What did Yahweh swear concerning Israel?

54.a: Yahweh's covenant of peace with Israel will not be shaken and his convenant faithfulness will not depart from Israel.
54.q: What will not be shaken and what will not depart from Israel?

54.a: Israel will no longer experience persecution.
54.q: What will Israel no longer experience?

54.a: Anyone who stirs up trouble for Israel will fall in defeat.
54.q: What will happen to anyone who stirs up trouble for Israel?
What will happen to everyone who accuses Israel?

55.a: They are told to buy wine and milk without money and without cost.
55.q: What are those who have no money told to buy?

55.a: They are told to eat what is good.
55.q: What are those who thirst told to eat?

55.a: Yahweh has placed David in that position.
55.q: Who has Yahweh placed as a witness to the nations and a leader and commander to the peoples?

55.a: They will run to Israel because Yahweh their God, the Holy One of Israel has glorified them.
55.q: Why will a nation that did not know Israel run to them?

55.a: They should seek him while he may be found; call upon him while he is nearby.
55.q: When should Israel seek and call upon Yahweh?

55.a: Let the wicked leave his path, and the man of sin his thoughts.
55.q: What are the wicked and the man of sin to do?

55.a: Yahweh will pity him and will abound in forgiving him.
55.q: What will Yahweh do for the one who returns to him?

55.a: This is so because as the heavens are higher than the earth so are Yahweh's ways higher than their ways and Yahweh's thought than Israel's thoughts.
55.q: Why are Yahweh's thoughts and ways not Israel's thoughts and ways?

55.a: They will accomplish that which Yahweh wishes and it will succeed in that for which he sent it.
55.q: What will happen to the words that go from Yahweh's mouth?

55.a: This is the sign: Israel will go out in joy and be led along peacefully. the mountains and the hills will break out in joyful shouts before them. All the trees of the fields will clap their hands. Instead of the thorn bushes, evergreens will grow and instead of the brier, the myrtle tree will grow.
55.q: What is the everlasting sign that will not be cut off?

56.a: He said this because his deliverance is near and his vindication is about to be revealed.
56.q: Why did Yahweh say to observe what is right and do what is just?

56.a: The foreigner should not say, "Yahweh will certainly exclude me from his people" and the eunuch should not say, "See, I am a dry tree."
56.q: What shouldn the foreigner and eunuch who have become followers of Yahweh not say?

56.a: Yahweh will set up a monument doe him, in Yahweh's house and within his walls, that is better than of sons and of daughters.
56.q: What will Yahweh do for eunuchs who observe Yahweh's sabbaths, choose what pleases him, and hold fast Yahweh's covenant?

56.a: Yahweh will bring them to his holy mountain and make them joyful in his house of prayer; their burnt offerings and sacrifices will be accepted on Yahweh's altar.
56.q: What will Yahweh do for foreigners who join themselves to Yahweh to serve him, who worship him and love his name, who observe the sabbath and keeps from defiling it, and who hold fast Yahweh's covenant?

56.a: Their watchmen are compared to dumb dogs.
56.q: Who is compared to a dumb dog?

56.a: They have all turned to their own way, each one covetous for unjust gain.
56.q: What have their watchmen and shepherds done?

57.a: They don't consider or understand that the righteous are gathered away from evil and enter into peace.
57.q: What does no one consider or understand about the righteous when they perish?

57.a: The sons of the sorceress, the children of the adulterer and the woman who has prostituted herself do these things.
57.q: Who is merrily mocking and opening the mouth and sticking out the tongue?

57.a: They had sex under the oaks, under every green tree. They killed their children in the dry riverbeds, under the rocky overhangs.
57.q: What else did these who were called children of rebellion and children of deceit do?

57.a: Some of the smooth things of the river valley are the objects of their devotion.
57.q: What are the objects of their devotion?
What did these rebellious and deceitful ones do concerning Yahweh?

57.a: Yahweh will tell them to let their collection of idols deliver them.
57.q: What will Yahweh tell these wicked and rebellious ones when they cry out?

57.a: The wind will carry them all away, a breath will carry them all away.
57.q: What will happen to these wicked and rebellious ones?

57.a: They will inherit the land and take possession of Yahweh's holy mountain.
57.q: What will happen to the ones who take refuge in Yahweh?

57.a: The ones who are of a crushed and humble spirit will dwell with Yahweh there.
57.q: Who will dwell with Yahweh in the exalted and holy place?

57.a: The man's spirit would faint before Yahweh.
57.q: What would happen if Yahweh accused man forever?

57.a: Yahweh was angry with man because of his violent gain.
57.q: Why was Yahweh angry with man?

57.a: Yahweh said he would heal him.
57.q: Even though Yahweh has seen man's ways, what is Yahweh going to do for man?

57.a: The wicked one has no peace.

58.a: He commanded the house of Jacob to be confronted with their rebellion and sins.
58.q: What did Yahweh command the house of Jacob to be confronted with?

58.a: They sought him like a nation that practiced righteousness and did not abandon the law of their God.
58.q: How did the house of Jacob seek Yahweh?

58.a: Their complaint to Yahweh was that when they fasted and humbled themselves Yahweh didn't see it or notice.
58.q: What was the complaint the house of Jacob made to Yahweh concerning them humbling themselves and fasting?

58.a: Yahweh said that on the day of their fast they find their own pleasure and oppress all their laborers.
58.q: What did Yahweh say the house of Jacob did on the day of their fast?

58.a: Yahweh said the house of Jacob was not fasting to make their voice heard above.
58.q: What did Yahweh say was not the reason the house of Jacob was fasting?

58.a: The fast that Yahweh chooses is to release wicked bonds, to undo the ropes of the yoke, to set the crushed ones free, to break every yoke, to break their bread with the hungry, to bring the poor and homeless into their houses, to clothe the naked and to not hide themselves from their own relatives.
58.q: What is the fast that Yahweh chooses?

58.a: If they would do these things then their light would rise in the darkness, and their darkness would be like the noonday. .
58.q: What would Yahweh do if the house of Jacob took away from among themselves the yoke, the accusing finger, and the speech of wickedness, if they provided for the hungry and satisfied the need of the distressed?

59.a: Yahweh's hand is not so short that it cannot save; nor his ear so dull, that is cannot hear.
59.q: Can Yahweh save us? Does he hear us?

59.a: Their sinful acts separated them from their God and their sins made Yahweh hide his face from them and from hearing them.
59.q: Why didn't Yahweh hear or save the house of Jacob?

59.a: Some of the sins that separated them from Yahweh were: They stained their hands with blood. They lied and spoke maliciously. They were malicious and untruthful. They conceived trouble.
59.q: What are some of the sins the house of Jacob committed that separated them from Yahweh?

59.a: Those who travel crooked paths do not know peace.
59.q: What happens to those who travel crooked paths?
What happened to him who turned away from evil?

59.a: It displeased Yahweh when he saw there was no justice.
When Yahweh saw there was no one to intervene, his own arm brought salvation for him.
59.q: What did Yahweh do when he saw there was no one to intervene?

59.a: He put on righteousness as a breastplate and a helmet of salvation upon his head. He clothed himself with garments of vengeance and wore zeal as a mantle. He repayed them for what they had done, angry judgment to his adversaries, vengeance to his enemies, to the islands punishment as their reward.
They will fear the name of Yahweh from the west, and his glory from the sun's rising.
59.q: What will be the result of Yahweh repaying them for what they had done?

59.a: A redeemer will come to Zion and to those who turn from their rebellious deeds in Jacob.
59.q: Who will a redeemer come to?

59.a: This is the covenant: Yahweh's spirit who is upon you, and my words which I have put in your mouth, will not leave your mouth, or go out of the mouth of your children, or go out of the mouth of your children's children from this time and forever.
59.q: What is Yahweh's covenant with them?

60.a: Yahweh will arise upon them and his glory will be seen on them.
60.q: Though darkness will cover the earth, what will Yahweh do for Israel?

60.a: Nations and kings will come to their light.
60.q: Who will come to Israel's light?

60.a: This will be because the abundance of the sea will be poured out to them, the wealth of the nations will come to them.
60.q: Why will Israel look and be radiant and their heart rejoice and overflow?
Who leads in bringing Israel's sons from afar?

60.a: Sons of foreigners will rebuild their walls and kings will serve them.
60.q: Who will rebuild the city of Yahweh and who will serve them?

60.a: They will remain open so that the wealth of the nations may be brought in.
60.q: Why will the gates of the city remain open continually?

60.a: Those nations and kingdoms will perish; they will be completely destroyed.
60.q: What will happen to those nations and kingdoms who will not serve them?

60.a: He will make her to be a thing of pride forever, a joy from generation to generation.
60.q: What will Yahweh make the City of Yahweh to be?

60.a: Violence will no longer be heard in their land, or devastation nor shattering within their borders.
60.q: What will no longer be heard in the land of Zion?

60.a: Yahweh will be their everlasting light.
60.q: What will give light to the land?

60.a: They will take possession of the land for all time.
60.q: For how long will Yahweh's people possess the land?

60.a: Yahweh will swiftly accomplish these things when the time comes.
60.q: How long will it take for Yahweh to accomplish these things?

61.a: The spirit is upon him because Yahweh has annointed him.
61.q: Why is the spirit of the Lord Yahweh upon him?

61.a: Yahweh has anointed him to proclaim good news to the humble.
61.q: What has Yahweh anointed him to do?

61.a: Yahweh has sent him to heal the brokenhearted, to proclaim liberty to the captives, to open the prison to those who are bound.
61.q: What are the first three things Yahweh sent him to do?

61.a: They will stand and feed the flocks of those in Zion and the sons of foreigners will work their fields and vineyards.
61.q: What will foreigners do in Zion?

61.a: They will be called priests of Yahweh; servants of God.
61.q: What will those in Zion be called?

61.a: Yahweh loves justice and hates robbery and violent injustice.
61.q: What does Yahweh love and what does he hate?

61.a: Yahweh has clothed him with garments of salvation and with the robe of righteousness.
61.q: What has Yahweh done for him?

61.a: He will cause righteousness and praise to sprout up in front of all the nations.
61.q: What will the Lord Yahweh cause to sprout up in front of all the nations

62.a: The nations will see Zion's righteousness and all kings will see her glory.
62.q: Who will see Zion's righteousness and glory?

62.a: Zion will no longer be called "Abandoned" and her land will no longer be called "Desolate".
62.q: What will no longer be said of Zion and her land?

62.a: She will be called those things because Yahweh delights in her and her land will be married.
62.q: Why will Zion be called "My delight is in her" and Zion's land "Married"?

62.a: They are put there to keep reminding Yahweh, allowing him no rest until he reestablishes Jerusalem and makes it a praise on earth.
62.q: Why have watchmen been put on the walls of Jerusalem?

62.a: He has sworn that he will no longer give Jerusalem's grain as food for their enemies, and foreigners won't drink her new wine.
62.q: What has Yahweh sworn by his right hand and by the arm of his strength?

62.a: This is Yahweh's announcement: "Say to the daughter of Zion, 'Look, your savior is coming! See, his reward is with him, and his reward goes before him.'".
62.q: What does Yahweh announce to the ends of the earth?

63.a: He is wearing red royal clothing and he comes marching confidently.
63.q: What is the one who comes from Edom wearing and how does he come?

63.a: He is marching confidently because of his great strength.
63.q: Why is the one from Edom marching so confidently?

63.a: He says he speaks righteousness and that he is powerfully able to save.
63.q: What does this one from Edom say about himself?

63.a: He was looking forward to the day of vengeance, and the year for his redemption had arrived.
63.q: What was this one from Edom looking forward to?

63.a: No. He looked but there was no one to help.
63.q: Was there anyone there to help this one from Edom?

63.a: He trampled down the peoples in his anger and made them drunk in his wrath and he splashed their blood on the earth.
63.q: What did this one from Edom do to the peoples?

63.a: He has shown them compassion because of his mercy and with many deeds of covenant faithfulness.
63.q: Why and how has Yahweh shown compassion to the house of Israel?

63.a: When the house of Israel suffered, Yahweh suffered.
63.q: What happened in the ancient times when Yahweh's people suffered?

63.a: The messenger of his presence saved them in the ancient times.
63.q: In the ancient times, who saved Israel?

63.a: He became their enemy because they rebelled and grieved his Holy Spirit.
63.q: Why did he become their enemy?

63.a: His name from ancient times has been "Our Redeemer".
63.q: What has been Yahweh's name from ancient times?

63.a: Their question and complaint was, "Yahweh, why do you make us wander from your ways and harden our hearts, so we do not obey you?"
63.q: What was the complaint or question of the house of Israel to Yahweh?

64.a: The nations would tremble at his presence.
64.q: What would happen if Yahweh's name was known by his adversaries?

64.a: No, no one has heard or perceived of any God who does things for those who wait for him.
64.q: Since ancient times has anyone heard or perceived of any God besides Yahweh, who does things for those who wait for him?

64.a: They are like a menstrual rag.
64.q: What are all of Israel's righteous deeds like?

64.a: This was so because Yahweh hid his face from them and handed them over to their sins.
64.q: Why were there none who called on Yahweh's name, who made an effort to take hold of him?

64.a: Yahweh is compared to a potter and the people of Israel are compared to clay.
64.q: What does the writer compare Yahweh and the people of Israel to?

64.a: Yahweh's holy cities have become a wilderness and Jerusalem a desolation.
64.q: What have Yahweh's holy cities become?

64.a: The two questions are, "How can you still hold back, Yahweh?" and "How can you remain silent and continue to humiliate us?"
64.q: What are the two questions the writer has for Yahweh?

65.a: He wanted to be sought out and found by those who did not ask and did not seek.
65.q: What did Yahweh want from those who did not ask and did not seek?

65.a: They have walked after their own thoughts and plans.
65.q: What have these stubborn people walk after?

65.a: They are a continual offense to Yahweh because they offer sacrifices in gardens and burn incense on brick tiles. They sit among the graves and keep watch all night and eat pork with the broth of foul meat in their dishes.
65.q: What are some of the ways these people have been a continual offense to Yahweh?

65.a: He has paid them back and will repay them for their own sins and the sins of their fathers.
65.q: What did and what will Yahweh do to these stubborn people?
What will Yahweh do for his chosen ones?

65.a: He will destine them for the sword and they will all bow down to the slaughter.
65.q: What will Yahweh do to those who abandon Yahweh?

65.a: They will eat, drink, rejoice and shout with joy.
65.q: What will happen to Yahweh's servants?

65.a: They will be hungry and thirsty. They will be put to shame and cry because of the pain of the heart and wail because of the crushing of the spirit.
65.q: What else will happen to those who abandon Yahweh?

65.a: Yahweh is going to create new heavens and a new earth.
65.q: What is Yahweh going to create?

65.a: They will be glad and rejoice forever in what Yahweh is about to create.
65.q: What will be the response of Yahweh's servants to the new heavens and new earth?

65.a: They will build houses and inhabit them, and they will plant vineyards and eat their fruit.
65.q: What will the people do in the new Jerusalem?

65.a: They will live long lives like unto the days of trees.
65.q: How many days will the people live?

65.a: While they are still speaking Yahweh will hear them, and before they call he will answer them.
65.q: In the new heavens and new earth when will Yahweh hear and answer his people?

65.a: The animals will no longer hurt or destroy one another. The wolf and the lamb will graze together, and the lion will eat straw like the ox.
65.q: What will be different about the animals on all Yahweh's holy mountain?

66.a: Yahweh made all these things with his own hand.
Yahweh approves of men who are broken and contrite in spirit and tremble at his word.
66.q: Of what kind of man does Yahweh approve?

66.a: Yahweh says a man who slaughters an ox also murders a man. One who sacrifices a lamb also breaks a dog's neck. He who offers a grain offering offers swine's blood and he who offers a memorial of incense also blessed wickedness.
66.q: What examples does Isaiah give to show man's hypocrisy?

66.a: Their brothers hate and exclude those who tremble at the word of Yahweh.
66.q: What do the brothers of those who tremble at the word of Yahweh do to them?

66.a: It was the sound of battle tumult coming from the city, the sound of Yahweh paying back his enemies.
66.q: What is the sound that came from the city and the temple?

66.a: We should rejoice with Jerusalem and be glad for her, for you will nurse and be satisfied; with her breasts you will be comforted; for you will drink to the full and be delighted with the abundance of her glory.
66.q: Why should all who love Jerusalem rejoice with her and be glad for her?

66.a: Yahweh is about to spread prosperity over Jerusalem like a river, and the riches of the nations like an overflowing stream.
66.q: What is Yahweh about to spread over Jerusalem?

66.a: He will use fire and his sword.
66.q: What will Yahweh use to execute judgment on mankind?

66.a: Yahweh will gather all nations and languages so they may come and see his glory and so that some of those who survive can return to their nations to proclaim Yahweh's glory among the nations.
66.q: Why will Yahweh gather all nations and languages?

66.a: The brothers of Israel from out of all the nations will be given as an offering to Yahweh.
66.q: Who will be given as an offering to Yahweh?

66.a: All people will come and bow down to Yahweh month to month and sabbath to sabbath.
66.q: What will the people do month to month and sabbath to sabbath?

66.a: Worms will eat them and fire will consume them.
66.q: What will happen to the dead bodies of the men who have rebelled against Yahweh?
